lead_paragraph: The trends among teenagers were encouraging, experts said, but other data in a national survey pointed to persistent prescription drug abuse by Americans.

headline.print_headline: New Lows in Smoking and Drinking Rates for Teenagers
headline.main: Smoking and Drinking Rates Among U.S. Teenagers Fall to New Lows

snippet: The trends among teenagers were encouraging, experts said, but other data in a national survey pointed to persistent prescription drug abuse by Americans....
abstract: Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration reports drop in teenage smoking and drinking; 9.6 percent of adolescents reported using alcohol in 2015, down from 17.6 percent in 2007, and 20 percent reported smoking daily, down from 32 percent in 2002.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration
